org.askalon.jlibcloud.compute.wrapperInterfaces

Interface ComputeContext

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    AbiquoComputeContext, BaseEC2ComputeContext, BrightboxComputeContext, CloudFramesComputeContext, CloudSigma_1_0_ComputeContext, CloudSigma_2_0_ComputeContext, CloudStackComputeContext, DigitalOceanComputeContext, DreamhostComputeContext, EC2ComputeContext, ElasticStackBaseComputeContext, GandiComputeContext, GCEComputeContext, GoGridComputeContext, HostVirtualComputeContext, IBMComputeContext, JoyentComputeContext, LibvirtComputeContext, LinodeComputeContext, NephoscaleComputeContext, OpenNebula_2_0_ComputeContext, OpenNebula_3_0_ComputeContext, OpenNebulaComputeContext, OpenStack_1_0_ComputeContext, OpenStack_1_1_ComputeContext, OpenStackComputeContext, OpsourceComputeContext, RimuHostingComputeContext, SoftLayerComputeContext, VCLComputeContext, VCloud_1_5_ComputeContext, VCloudComputeContext, VoxelComputeContext, VPSNetComputeContext

    public interface ComputeContext
    Represents a node driver. Offers functions to interact with a provider. A ComputeContext is instanciated using ComputeContextBuilder

      blocking waits for a list of nodes to get in the running state. nodes in the state shutdown are excluded. the polling rate is set to 5 seconds and the method returns after 600 seconds

    • Method Detail

      • createNode

        java.util.List<? extends Node> createNode(NodeTemplate nodeTemplate)
        create a node for this driver
        Parameters:
        nodeTemplate - a nodeTemplate for this driver
        Returns:
        a list with the newly created node(s), these nodes do not have an IP adress assigned and should be refetched when they are in the state running

      • deployNode

        @Deprecated
java.util.List<? extends Node> deployNode(NodeTemplate nodeTemplate)
        Deprecated. 
        !This method isn't yet supported and threfore marked as @Deprecated!

        deploys a node. Deploying allows to use the deploy() method of the nodeTemplate and the deployment classes from: org.askalon.jlibcloud.compute.wrapperInterfaces.deployment

        !not every driver supports the deploy method and will throw an exception if not!

        Parameters:
        nodeTemplate -
        Returns:
        a list with the newly created node(s)

      • waitUntilRunning

        boolean waitUntilRunning(java.util.List<Node> nodes)
        blocking waits for a list of nodes to get in the running state. nodes in the state shutdown are excluded. the polling rate is set to 5 seconds and the method returns after 600 seconds
        Parameters:
        nodes -
        Returns:
        true if the node starts befor timeout

      • waitUntilRunning

        boolean waitUntilRunning(java.util.List<Node> nodes,
                       java.lang.Integer waitPeriodSeconds,
                       java.lang.Integer timeoutSeconds)
        blocking waits for a list of nodes to get in the running state. nodes in the state shutdown are excluded.
        Parameters:
        nodes -
        waitPeriodSeconds - the polling intervall for checking the node status
        timeoutSeconds - the time after the method should return
        Returns:
        true if all nodes are in state running before timeoutSeconds exceeds else false

      • listNodesMatching

        java.util.List<? extends Node> listNodesMatching(java.util.List<Node> nodes)
        Use this method to get the current status of a node. If a node was just created and has no IP adress, this method can be used to refetch the node, to update the IP field.
        Parameters:
        nodes - a list of nodes
        Returns:
        the updated list of nodes

      • setNodeProperties

        void setNodeProperties(java.lang.String filepath)
        Loads a given properties file for the ComputeContext from the given filepath. The ComputeContext uses the properties when creating a node, if the required fields in the NodeTemplate are uninitialized.

        For valid attribute names use the Javadoc name from NodeTemplate.class or the NodeTemplateBuilder.class. Allowed fields for the standard ComputeContext are: 

         name=nodeName
 image_id=someImage
 size_id=someSize
 location_id=location
 ex_keyname=someKey
        In general for the ComputeContext and derived classes alls String, int, boolean and float values can be read from a .properties file. List\ or String[] values can also be read. Therfore add an an index from [0,14] to the attribute name. for example: 
         ex_security_groups0=group1
 ex_security_groups1=group2
 ex_security_groups2=group3
        Parameters:
        filepath - path to the .properties file

      • getTemplateBuilder

        NodeTemplateBuilder getTemplateBuilder()
        Returns:
        the template builder for this driver

      • getProviderName

        java.lang.String getProviderName()
        Returns:
        the name of the provider
